SEARCH
Package edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.util

Class LinkedStackTest

java.lang.Object
edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.util.LinkedStackTest
public class LinkedStackTest extends Object
Unit tests for the LinkedStack class. This class contains test cases to validate the functionality of the LinkedStack class, including push and pop operations, capacity management, and edge cases such as attempting to push beyond capacity or pop from an empty stack. Author: Suyash Patel

  • Constructor Details

    • LinkedStackTest

      public LinkedStackTest()

  • Method Details

    • setUp

      @BeforeEach public void setUp()
      Sets up the test environment before each test case. Initializes a new LinkedStack with a capacity of 5.

    • testConstructorValid

      @Test public void testConstructorValid()
      Tests the constructor for valid and invalid capacity values. Verifies that a stack can be created with a capacity of 0, but not with a negative capacity.

    • testPushValidElement

      @Test public void testPushValidElement()
      Tests the push operation by adding valid elements to the stack. Verifies that the size increases after each push.

    • testPushNullElement

      @Test public void testPushNullElement()
      Tests the push operation with a null element. Verifies that an IllegalArgumentException is thrown when attempting to push a null element onto the stack.

    • testPushCapacityReached

      @Test public void testPushCapacityReached()
      Tests the push operation when the stack reaches its capacity. Verifies that an IllegalArgumentException is thrown when attempting to push beyond the stack's capacity.

    • testPopValid

      @Test public void testPopValid()
      Tests the pop operation by removing the most recently pushed element. Verifies that the correct element is returned and the stack size decreases.

    • testPopEmptyStack

      @Test public void testPopEmptyStack()
      Tests the pop operation on an empty stack. Verifies that an EmptyStackException is thrown when attempting to pop from an empty stack.

    • testIsEmpty

      @Test public void testIsEmpty()
      Tests the isEmpty method. Verifies that the method returns true for an empty stack and false after an element is pushed.

    • testSize

      @Test public void testSize()
      Tests the size method. Verifies that the size of the stack is updated correctly after each push operation.

    • testSetCapacityValid

      @Test public void testSetCapacityValid()
      Tests the setCapacity method with a valid capacity. Verifies that the capacity can be increased, and it does not throw an exception when reducing capacity within limits.

    • testSetCapacityInvalid

      @Test public void testSetCapacityInvalid()
      Tests the setCapacity method with invalid capacities. Verifies that an IllegalArgumentException is thrown when attempting to set a capacity less than the current stack size or setting a negative capacity.
